data.title: Fast Food at Its Best
data.text: This is not your typical fast food restaurant.  It's great salads, sandwiches and bagels carefully and tastefully prepared at a quicker than sit down restaurant pace.  On the weekends, this place is very busy and crowded.  Patience leads to a great bite to eat.  One observation--why is the music for the food preparation clerks sooo loud that you can hear it in the eating area?  Actually, do they need their music in order to do their job?

data.title: Mmmm Mmmm Good!
data.text: We have been coming here for years and years! I love the jalapeño bagel with Nova and egg! The place is usually jam packed with all kinds of people and their dogs.

data.title: Good food Very Homey place
data.text:
Always enjoy Bagels and Brew. The menu selections are varied and the food is good.
Sometimes a little slow but worth the wait.

data.title: Vast menu and everything we ate on a few visits was yummy
data.text: Family took us here for breakfast and we returned on our own for lunches a couple more times during a brief visit to the area.  The *huge* menu can seem daunting but it seems whatever you select will be delicious.

data.title: Great food - don't bother with text orders
data.text:
We have eaten here many times. Food and drinks are consistently very good = reason for 3 stars. Organization and customer experience suffer a bit. Most employees are very young and organization/ customer service can be good or not so good. Most employees are trying to do a good job but can get overwhelmed. Often there are long lines at peak times. 
Recently a "text order" or "call in order" service was implemented but don't bother. It takes more time and a lot more frustration than waiting in line. You still have to wait in line to pay for your text order. Often the register that is supposed to be for text orders is closed, especially when busy, but there is zero communication to customers to let them know register is closed. Employers simply ignore customers waiting in that line and expect you to figure it out on your own. Even if register is open and you pay there, the communication between employees that you have paid for your order is lacking. I have been asked to pay for different parts of same text order multiple times and challenged each time to prove I had paid for whole order. Additionally, since order comes out piecemeal, and is kept behind counter, it becomes difficult to get any employee's attention to give lagging parts to you. Save yourself the frustration and just wait in line.

data.title: The Community Gathering Place
data.text: Bagels & Brew is a popular place.  The Bagels and the Brew are good.  The parking is adequate. The atmosphere is above average. Fortunately, for the owners, a popular place with decent bagels and coffee is very very busy. Unfortunately, the staff has little to no oversight and appear to prioritize the catering orders rather than the customers standing in line and/or waiting for a bagel.  I do like Bagels & Brew but it's extremely frustrating waiting and waiting for a simple bagel and cream cheese while the staff is stuffing boxes with catering orders.  My message to the owners is simple.....improve the throughput for customers coming in for a bagel and I will change my rating to 5 stars!

data.title: Great Breakfast or Lunch
data.text: Friendly, fast and great food.  Inside and outside eating area.  I can recommend this to everyone who wants to have a fast and enjoyable meal.

data.title: Love their sandwiches!
data.text: Yes, they have very good bagels, but their sandwiches are wonderful.  Choice of breads but my favorite is on a bagel.  A bit on the pricey side ($7-$8) but well worth it.

data.title: Great setting by the old school house
data.text: It's good from bagels for breakfast and coffee to lunch and sandwiches. They have a very good variety not only of bagels but sandwiches and indoor and outdoor dining a great place for meeting friends and family

data.title: The World's Best
data.text: By far, the bagel breakfasts and lunches are the most delicious I have ever tasted. Generous, fresh ingredients are in every meal. Love this place!

data.title: Local favorite with a broad menu
data.text: Been coming here on a regular basis since we moved to Lake Forest nearly 20 years ago. It's one of the few non-chain restaurants that have stayed open during that time, and it's easy to see and taste why with a visit. I'm not a huge bagel eater but I have friends who are, and are discriminating (and won't hesitate to criticize if the food is poor!), and they've praised the quality when I've taken them there. One friend who lives in Irvine now makes it a regular stop when he's in the area. I enjoy the Bialy bagel and the egg bagel, however I prefer their pastries, of which they usually have a good selection, better than any of the remaining local coffee places. I've had several of their breakfast and lunch offerings including egg dishes and sandwiches and they are excellent. pricing is very reasonable, in fact it's about the cheapest place for breakfast and lunch around, especially when you consider the quality ingredients. I recently discovered they serve lattes and other specialty coffees created with almond milk. That is a boon for me as I've gone from lactose intolerant to full milk-allergic so it had been years since I'd been able to enjoy a latte. Our local Starbucks doesn't offer that option, just soy milk which I think tastes terrible or worse, coconut milk. So another reason to visit. They have a good selection of brewed coffee reasonably priced. The atmosphere is relaxed, staff is friendly and efficient, the only caveat is the popularity of this establishment can lead to crowds on weekend mornings, but it's worth the wait and they have tables outside for nice days.

data.title: Great food, poor service
data.text: The food is awesome, but unfortunately the staff is several teens who seem not to understand customer service. They are super slow, do not smile, and their body language indicate they rather be elsewhere. However, barring that, the food is great, and the coffee great too!! This is near where I live so I have been there lots. Their egg/bacon breakfast bagel is AWESOME!

data.title: Too busy for their own good
data.text:
We've been here lots of times and the food and service has always been good.  So we decided to try it on a Sunday.  Bad idea.  They were very busy, and maybe that was the problem.  There were lots of people waiting for their orders.  One family waited so long they changed their order from eating in, to a to-go order.  They said they had to be somewhere.  When we sat down they were waiting for their food.  We received out order - and they were still waiting.  Mind you, we only ordered bagels and they ordered sandwiches but we were almost done by the time they got their food.

As for our bagels,  toasted doesn't mean sliced and warmed up.  You have to put it in the toaster and let it get brown.  There should also be an attempt to spread the cream cheese, not throw a glob on one side and close it up.

It's still a good place to go.  Their bagels are good - we'll just go on a weekday when they're not so busy.

data.title: Bagels & Brew says it all!
data.text: Wonderful little spot to visit and enjoy bagels and coffee. Often crowded....all locals, that means you could get some good info during your travels. They have a patio with umbrellas. Keep in mind......crowded....but, good. Great for lunch, too!!

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Been having lunch at B & B for years.  Chicken Club sandwich always great.   Great to have so many choices on the type of bread or bagels.

data.title: Always great!
data.text: We have been coming here for years. (Decades) Great place for breakfast, lunch or just a coffee stop. The Amigo toasted  rocks!

data.title: Our local favorite
data.text: Fresh, quality ingredients make great food.  Friendly, curious staff make a great environment.  Have both and you get a 5 of 5 from me!

data.title: Pleasantly surprised!
data.text: I had had breakfasts and lunches catered by Bagels & Brew for business, but had never been there in person. I was expecting a small, crowded, fast-food place but was pleasantly surprised to find a relatively large eating area with tables inside and out, a vast menu from which to choose, and good food! I had the spinach salad with chicken and it was great! The food was ready quickly and the service was good. When I was done with my lunch, the waitress cleared it away for me. I'll definitely be back.

data.title: Thee corner gathering place for friends and homemade meals, bagels, smoothies, etc .  in Lake Forest
data.text: Best breakfasts, smoothies, coffee, bagels, every assortment of cream cheese variations, perfect bacon every time - the gathering place early mornings and weekends for friends and neighbors!!

data.title: Wholesome and doughy
data.text: Bagels and Brew has yummy everything!  Go there for a bagel, a sandwich, fantastic cream cheese varieties, a salad, or their delicious coffee.  Does not disappoint.
